description: Fixed version with timelock for large withdrawals to prevent instant fund drainage
root_cause: Single-key access control with immediate execution. If the owner's private key is compromised, attacker can instantly drain all funds with no delay or additional authorization required.

transformation.fix_description: Added TIMELOCK_DELAY (24 hours), LARGE_WITHDRAWAL_THRESHOLD (10 ether), PendingWithdrawal struct, pendingWithdrawals mapping. Large withdrawals are queued and require executeQueuedWithdrawal() after timelock expires.

exact_changes.version_b: // No timelock constants or pending withdrawal tracking

transformation.why_fix_works: Timelock gives operators 24 hours to detect key compromise and respond (revoke, transfer ownership, or recover funds) before large withdrawals can execute.
